## HookDriver.call() method

Invokes corresponding `hook fn`<!-- -->s according to `name` in [type](./processor.hooktype.md) mode.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
call<Name extends HookName, T extends HookType>(name: Name, type: T, ...args: Parameters<Hooks[Name]>): Promise<T extends 'first' ? ReturnType<Hooks[Name]> : void>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  name | Name | The <code>hook name</code> this <code>hook driver</code> could call with |
|  type | T | The <code>hook type</code> |
|  args | Parameters&lt;Hooks\[Name\]&gt; | The args of the <code>hook fn</code> |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;T extends 'first' ? ReturnType&lt;Hooks\[Name\]&gt; : void&gt;

The return value of the `hook fn` if `type` is `first` else nothing
